intro: Corytholoma glaziovianum, commonly known as the Glaziov's conebush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean-type climates. Its unique conebush form and vibrant floral display make it a distinctive ornamental plant. It is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
